solution.text:
Addition of two rational numbers gives a rational number, therefore it is closed under addition.
Multiplication of two rational numbers is a rational number, therefore it is closed under multiplication.
Subtraction of two rational numbers is a rational number, therefore it is closed under subtraction.
Division of two rational numbers is not always a rational number .For example- \(\frac{1}{0}\) is undefined.

content.text: Closure property of rational numbers is applicable for which of the following operations ?
